name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole has a melting point around 100°C. The methylene bridge (O=C1C(SC2=NCCCN12)=Cc4ccc3OCOc3c4) adds rigidity and molecular weight, contributing approximately +20°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +30°C. The pyrimidine ring also contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of two phenyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may add approximately +30°C due to the increase in molecular weight and pi-pi interactions.
